lead_paragraph: The Syrian war is often cast as a contest between competing rebel groups and the government of President Bashar al-Assad. The truth is even messier.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Maher Samaan from Paris; Hwaida Saad from Beirut; an employee of The New York Times from Damascus, Syria; Falih Hassan and Omar Al-Jawoshy from Baghdad; Thomas Erdbrink from Tehran; and Andrew E. Kramer from Moscow.

headline.print_headline: In Syria’s War, Turmoil Starts With Tangled Web of Alliances
headline.main: In Fight for Aleppo, Tangled Alliances in Syria Add to Chaos

snippet: The Syrian war is often cast as a contest between competing rebel groups and the government of President Bashar al-Assad. The truth is even messier....
abstract: Syrian civil war intensifies as increasingly tangled alliances, including involvement of Iraqi militiamen and Iranian Revolutionary Guard members, escalate tensions between Russia and United States in  battle for city of Aleppo.
